activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew E. Wilcox

records.addlTxt:
3:48 PM Defendant Matthew E. Wilcox in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Matthew E. Wilcox.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
calling 22cf221 and 220tr2079 and 20cf163 for motion to rescind.
In receipt of new complaint, waive reading - Defendant will waive preliminary hearing at this time. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Bail continued in both cases. 
Magallones has not yet been assigned to 20cf163 but request it track along with 22cf221
Court will remove 11-14 review hearing on 20cf163.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Defendant Matthew E. Wilcox appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF221 & 22TR2079. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail - Defendant on PO hold. Court sets bond. adj. 02:09 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
